intro: Centaurea kartschiana var. coronata, commonly known as the Crowned Cornflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features striking blue to purple flowers with a distinctive crown-like appearance at the base of the petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
